descriptionSet.description: In this poster calender from Hari Krishna Karyalaya (office), Bareilly Rajasthan (1972), a couple can be seen smiling at each other. In the background, a field full of crops, a water pump, poultry and farm animals can be seen. The man is carrying a plough and the woman is carrying a sickle.

inscription.text: नकली मालो से सावधान हरी कृष्ण कार्यालय (रजि.) बरेली उच्च कोटी के चूर्ण एवं मसालो के निर्माता शिवाजी मार्ग, बरेली
मसाले: दाल मसाला, चाट मसाला, रायता मसाला, जीरा वटी असली हींग वटी, हर वटी, जल जीरा, सँत दन्त मजंन चाय मसाला चूर्ण: लुकमानि चूर्ण, छुआरा चूर्ण, भूका चूर्ण, नारंगी चूर्ण, पशु चूर्ण

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

text-en: Phone: Resi.: 6541 Office: 6661
text-hi: नकली मालो से सावधान हरी कृष्ण कार्यालय (रजि.) बरेली उच्च कोटी के चूर्ण एवं मसालो के निर्माता शिवाजी मार्ग, बरेली
text-hi: मसाले: दाल मसाला, चाट मसाला, रायता मसाला, जीरा वटी असली हींग वटी, हर वटी, जल जीरा, सँत दन्त मजंन चाय मसाला चूर्ण: लुकमानि चूर्ण, छुआरा चूर्ण, भूका चूर्ण, नारंगी चूर्ण, पशु चूर्ण
text-translation-hi: Hari Krishna Karyalaya (office) Bareilly Rajasthan
text-en: Studio Jothis
text-en: 1972

description-en: In this poster calender from Hari Krishna Karyalaya (office), Bareilly Rajasthan (1972), a couple can be seen smiling at each other. In the background, a field full of crops, a water pump, poultry and farm animals can be seen. The man is carrying a plough and the woman is carrying a sickle. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Work for the nation is an heavily marked theme in the post-1947 period: we have seen that often this is linked to the contribution made by new technologies, tools, and heavy-industry development in general, even when it is voluptuous women (so often the case) being presented. These visual narratives, combining traditional occupations with modern technological breakthroughs, convey a strong message about the cultural specificities of a ‘modern’ India. Among those specificities, as we’ve noted, is the place of agrarian India, however voluptuous and technologized it may be in this imagined universe. (Sandria B. Freitag) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The woman holding the sickel in her hand refers symbolically to the socialist bloc countries' shared principles economy, suggesting growth, prosperity and happiness for developing and rural India in the context of the enthusiasm promulgated towards the 'Green Revolution' (e.g. chemical fertilizers).() (cb)
